i vacuum seal many foods to protect them from freezer burn , but that method does not work for everything . i ran into a problem with lobster tails and crab legs . in my household these are special treats , purchased once or twice a year . since i live inland , fresh is not an option . i try to wait for a good sale and then buy ahead for use on special occasions , like holidays or birthdays . purchased at the grocery meat counter they are already frozen but handed to me in butcher paper . i need to re - package them for a month or two of storage with a goal of avoiding freezer burn . when i tried to vacuum seal , the spiny nature of the items pierced the material so i used zip - lock freezer bags . the results were mixed primarily because it is difficult to remove all air from those bags . this product is thicker than regular wrap so it not only permits tightly wrapping , even several layers if necessary while squeezing air out . as added insurance , i then place them in a zip lock freezer bag . much better way to protect pricey , but thorny food . a good addition to my food storage supplies .

de cecco is one of the better brands of pasta from italy . not the best by any means , but pretty darn good . in italy pasta is graded with the letter " i " ( lower case ) . in the us , they can call almost anything pasta . major brands like ronzoni and barilla ( yes , barilla sold in this county is made in this country with the same ingredients as ronzoni ) are usually half flour . in italy , even the worst grade of pasta is only allowed to have qqq % or less flour . real pasts is qqq % durham semolina and no flour . the italian ratings for pasta are as follows : dried pasta with three subcategories ( i. ) durum wheat semolina pasta ( pasta di semola di grano duro ) , ( ii . ) low grade durum wheat semolina pasta ( pasta di semolato di grano duro ) and ( iii . ) durum wheat whole meal pasta ( pasta di semola integrale di grano duro ) . pastas made under this category must be made only with durum wheat semolina or durum wheat whole - meal semolina and water , with an allowance for up to qqq % of soft - wheat flour as part of the durum flour . dried pastas made under this category must be labeled according to the subcategory . so , first make sure your pasta is qqq % durham semolina . de cecco is . years ago , de cecco used bronze dies to extrude their pastas . that gives them a rougher texture to grab onto the sauce ( gravy ) . they only do that now with a few of their varieties now . that 's too bad . if you want a real pasta that is made from the finest durham semolina and that rough texture because of the dies used to make it , try cucina antica . nice rough surface to hold the sauce and a very high grade of semolina that you can smell the aroma of when cooking and serving . there are many other high end pastas that have that great semolina taste and aroma and rough surface to hold onto the sauce , but they can cost about ten bucks per pound . like i said , de cecco is a good brand of everyday pasta , but you can also get may other brands from italy that are about equal to de cecco ( like anna , farrara and a bunch of others ) for less money . just check that they are from italy and are qqq % durham semolina and no flour .

i like using non - breakables when i relax on the patio -- i do n't need to worry about broken glass clean - ups -- so i tend to use paper or plastic plates and cups . i 've used the qqq - oz standard plastic cups quite often , so i was curious to see if these were really any different . actually , they are . first , when they say " easy grip , " they mean it . the exterior is textured which makes them less likely to slip . that 's a plus for iced drinks that develop condensation . i did n't think it would make that much difference but it really does . second , they say " crack resistant " -- and they are . i did a " crush test " with my old cups vs these -- very noticeable difference . i used a stack of cookbooks to see if i could get the cups to collapse from the from side pressure . with the old cups , it took only my joy of cooking + my better homes & gardens cookbooks to crush from the side with corresponding cracks on each side . with these new cups , it took all of the above plus " mastering the art of french cooking " ( both volumes ) to cause the cup to collapse from the side -- but the cup didn't crack ; it just collapsed . the difference is the thickness and pliability of the " rolled " rim . and then there 's the size . these are qqq oz . my old cups are qqq oz . two ounces may not make much of a difference , but that extra space allows for more ice , more whatever . i use one of these for the entire day -- just rinse out and refill with whatever . so bottom line -- i like these . i like them enough to switch from my old brand .

apparently it works fine , for it disappears after each wash . the main issue i have with this product is that it comes in powder form , making it a little on the inconvenient side to dispense properly . since our dishwasher does not have any compartment for powder form , and i believe most of the newer ones do not , you are required to pour it at the bottom of the dishwasher and let the machine handle the rest . besides the gel packs we currently use and the liquid finish to aid in the drying process this product could be construed as overkill , but we really enjoy to see the end results delivering a consistent extra clean , extra dry , spot free wash . for the reason alone that it came in powder form ( i had assumed from the picture that it would be liquid and that it could go on the liquid dispenser ) i rated it a little lower . i have not experienced left overs of the powder , as some reviewers claimed . in that case , of course , this product would be almost useless . so far it has worked in that it disappears completely from the bottom where it is placed . i tried it once by putting a flat glass cup plate at the bottom and filling it up . it also disappeared leaving only a very small residue of water on the plate . i found it inconvenient so i started using directly as instructed . dishes and glasses have been thoroughly cleaned , but like i mentioned i use the gel pack and the liquid finish rinse in addition , so in the end i got an above performance when i used the qqq products . does it clean less without this one product ? maybe so , but i was getting a very nice clean before adding the finish power up booster agent , qqq ounce , so i can not say for how much the cleaning has improved . would i buy this same product again ? probably not , knowing that there are so many other products of equal performance that do not require that method of usage . they recommend to qqq tbs but i probably use a little more , for it is hard to be precise whey you are just pouring . once again very thankful to amazon , a class act from way back , for allowing me to try this product , and i rate this product qqq , mostly for the inconvenient way in which it has to be used

oatmeal is good for you . as you know , it 's a great source of fiber and lowers cholesterol . most americans do n't get nearly as much fiber as they should , so incorporating oatmeal into your morning routine has health benefits . my parents , for example , are in their qqq 's and qqq 's and they eat a bowl of oatmeal every day at breakfast . for heavy users such as them , this is the most economical way to buy quaker oats . at the time of writing , if you use subscribe & save , it 's less than $ qqq ! one box has qqq servings , if you make it according to the suggested portion size . that 's a fantastic bargain , especially if you have a large family . a single qqq oz canister costs nearly $ qqq where i live . this box is qqq lbs of the stuff ! we prefer the old fashioned over the minute version . you are probably very experienced with cooking oats , but in case you are not : the old fashioned needs to be brought to a boil on the stove and cooked for several minutes until desired tenderness , but the extra work is worth it because it has better chewiness than the quick oats . i tend to make mine less watery so i can transport it to work and eat it there . that way it stays nice and firm , and the oats will reabsorb some of the water over time and improve texture . it is better to undercook than overcook because undercooking can be fixed later in a microwave . if overcooked , there 's not much you can do with the mush . i like my oatmeal cold . it shrinks the oats and gives them a better mouthfeel , but everyone has his / her own preference . to cut down on calories and sugar , i only use a spoon of strawberry preserve or some other kind of jam . for texture , i add chopped walnuts . ( < a data - hook="product - link - linked " class="a - link - normal " href="/kirkland - signature - qqq - pounds / dp / qqq / ref = cm_cr_arp_d_rvw_txt?ie = qqq signature walnuts , qqq pounds are excellent ) . you can add bananas , berries , brown sugar , honey , maple syrup or any other sweetener . you can also make granola bars or oatmeal cookies with oatmeal , of course . note : the pictured canister is not included . this is simply a very large bulk box of oatmeal . inside are two plain qqq lb plastic bags . i recommend saving your empty canisters to put the oats in , for daily use . the rest , you can put back in the box and store until you need to refill the canister . this will make it easier to handle the oats , versus a big clumsy bag .

love this scent and so glad i can get this thru prime pantry because it has been impossible for me to find in stores . my daughter ( age qqq ) loves it too and i really believe it helps us both get to sleep . i do n't spray this directly on her linens but i do spritz it in her room while she 's in the tub . i catch her taking deep breaths while i 'm reading her bedtime stories and visibly relaxing ! i do too ! the scent is very herbal smelling and not perfumey like other lavender sleepytime room sprays . no strong alcohol ( there 's none ! ) or artificial smell which is common in room sprays . the bottle is eensy so i 'm not sure how long it will last . i 'm only spraying it a couple of times in her room and the scent lasts a good while . maybe qqq - qqq hours ? hopefully it will last a long time because $ qqq is kind of a lot to pay for such a small bottle . but i am happy to pay it because both my daughter and i respond to aromatherapy . this helps decrease stress and helps us relax at night . i ca n't put a dollar amount on that ! edit : i just wanted to add that this makes a great " monster spray " . my daughter is going through the phase of being afraid of monsters under the bed , shadows , etc . i did the same thing when i was a kid and i was so angry when my parents would minimize my concerns with just saying that monsters were n't real and to go to sleep . so instead of doing that , i spray the spray and tell my daughter that it gets rid of the monsters . i also tell her that mom and dad are way scarier than any old monster and we practice making mean scary faces together , she giggles , and she is n't stressed out anymore ! since she started this phase i keep the spray where she can reach it and if she feels scared she can spray it herself . she has n't sprayed it but i think just putting it near her helps because she thinks she has something to defend herself with .

like a lot of people , cashews are my favorite nuts even though they are not the healthiest . i prefer whole cashews over pieces and was thrilled to try this . at the outset , i 'll say that this is my third bag of happy belly nuts . the raw and roasted / salted almonds were terrific and i hoped the cashews would be as well . i was pleased by the moderate saltiness . too much salt ruins the flavor as far as i 'm concerned , and these were nicely light , dusted with sea salt , quite a bit of which had accumulated at the bottom of the bag . speaking of the bag , i would say that about qqq % to qqq % of the cashews i received were whole . obviously in packaging and shipping , some of the nuts were split or broken , but considering the bag arrived in a basic cardboard box with some plastic air pillows , i 'd say it 's pretty good . as for the taste , they seemed nicely roasted to me . i am a fan of cashews , not a connoisseur , but i definitely got the smooth buttery taste i am used to and look for . these cashews come from india and vietnam according to the packaging . there are only three ingredients : cashews , vegetable oil , and sea salt . the nuts were not greasy or slick . overall , these work for me and i 'd get them again .

it was a magical summer when i first had the pleasure of meeting lemon oreos last year . throughout the summer , those lemon oreos and i were constant companions . we went together on picnics . we hung out during cookouts . we snuck in together to see guardians of the galaxy . and it was a fantastic relationship ... until nabisco ended the run and we were parted , like a summer fling that abruptly ends . and now , after months of nostalgia and dreaming and half - hearted dalliances with the girl scouts ' savannah smiles , lemon oreos are back . or are they ? like seeing that high school crush after an intervening summer , this oreo is n't * quite * as i remember . sure , the looks are the same . the style is there . but there 's just something .... off . and i freely admit that perhaps my memories of that first summer are perhaps rosier than they actually were , but the taste of these oreos just seems a little different . i hate to use the term " shoe polish , " because that sounds much harsher than it actually is , but that 's what 's coming to mind . the lemon flavor just seems a little more pungent than what i tasted in that summer of qqq . do n't get me wrong - these are still very good , especially if you do n't care for the chocolate cookie of the original oreo . and it still pairs well with ice cold milk . and you can make a seriously good no - bake cheesecake with them . so there 's all of that . but i still ca n't shake the feeling that something has changed between us . and it vexes me . all that aside , the lemon oreo is a superior expression of the sandwich cookie . get some . savor them . and then get some more . they are that good .

that subject line surely sounds stupid ... to anyone who does n't have to watch what they eat , that is . :) this things are addictive ! in about a day , i 'd mowed through almost the whole bag . the only reason that i say " almost " is because i was _ trying _ to limit myself . yes , i 'm weak ... i 've been a pretzel fan for about qqq years , often preferring them over other types of snacks . hard pretzels , soft pretzels , sticks , twists , nuggets , plain , flavored ... i rarely have met a pretzel that i did n't like . these are no exception . mmmm , delicious . these really are very good , with the good quality that i expect from snyder 's . i like their sourdough nuggets because they are easy to pop into my mouth and have a great crunch , and these have a similar size and crunch but with their regular pretzel dough - and a tasty peanut butter interior . i was hesitant to order these at first because i was thinking that the peanut butter would be soft and sticky , but it is n't at all . consistency - wise , it 's kind of like what you 'd get inside of a reese 's peanut butter cup but a little more firm . taste - wise , it tastes like regular peanut butter ( so , not sweet like in the peanut butter cups ) . the salty taste and crunch of a pretzels , with the softer and peanutty tasting interior , are a great combination . sure , that combination has been around for a long time , and there are other good brands out there . snyder 's did a great job with their version , too . i kind of wish that there was more peanut butter in it nugget , because then i 'd get my fill of it faster . snyder 's was brilliant in putting just enough in that i keep wanting more . sneaky little geniuses . well played , snyder 's .

my normal disinfecting wipe is the clorox wipes . i saw these on sale here at amazon though for such a great price that i had to try them . i actually really like them just as much as the clorox wipes . this is saying alot because i have been using the clorox wipes religiously and have recommended them to anyone who would listen , ever since they came out . they work well for light cleaning virtually any surface except for mirrors of course . i do not notice any streaking , even on black appliances . they pick up hairs and small crumbs too . i like using them at the end of the day to wipe everything down before bed . they are so very convenient . i keep a canister in every room of my house , and extras in all the closets . the kids even keep them in their rooms and wipe down their dressers and random belongings and surfaces . they are more prone to cleaning up their messes in the kitchen and bathroom too , since they can just grab a wipe out of the canister , wipe away the mess and then throw it away . a lot easier and quicker than grabbing a cleaning product and sponge or rag and then having to rinse the sponge or rag and then put everything away . i would say you could do most all of your cleaning with these , minus windows and glass . it might not be the most cost effective to use them in this manner unless you catch a really good sale , but it is definitely an option . i personally reach for them more often than the typical cleaning products . quick , easy and they disinfect too , so you do n't have to worry about germs . the scent is fresh and clean , citrus . not over powering and they definitely smell better than regular various scented lysol cleaners . definitely recommended as a must have item to keep on hand at all times . i keep them in the car too and use them on all surfaces , including my leather seats .

this plastic bag is designed as a liner to make crock pot clean up easier . ( as if crock pot cooking was n't already about the laziest meal there is already ... ) you do n't close the bag to seal in juices or anything so it has no effect on your recipe . to test it , i made a pot roast , using the directions from the box . i was careful loading and stirring my ingredients and let everything cool well before i tried to remove the bag . despite my care , the bag had a hole and the bottom of the crock was full of liquid from the roast . i still had to spend about as much time washing the crock as i would without the bag -- plus i had a gloppy bag to deal with . honestly , my removable , ceramic crock is not that hard to clean , unless the recipe has some sort of sauce that gets seriously burnt on around the rim , in which case i can just soak it for a few hours . i suppose if you have an older crock pot without a removable insert , the bag would be worth using . for me , it was n't effective enough to add a buck to the cost of every recipe . oh , and the pot roast recipe is ok , but i 'd suggest adding the potatoes about halfway through rather than at the start . most of mine were mush by the time the meat was done .

i enjoy both cheddar cheese and i like the well known sour cream and onion flavor , so i that it would be a wise decision to try these chips that combine those two flavors . i can honestly tell you i was not disappointed ! the flavor is a little hard to describe but as you would imagine , you get a nice cheesy overtone with the distinctive flavor of sour cream near the end . they are quite addictive and not as salty as one would imagine . they are fairly thin and crispy so i would not recommend these for any kind of thick dip because they will break apart . they are perfectly fine by themselves anyway and do n't require any kind of topping at all since they already come coated with that unique flavoring . being that these are so light , you can hardly stop from eating them and they will go quickly in a house of hungry people ( this size bag would probably last my family anywhere from a week to two weeks or even as little as a day depending on our self - control ) . this would be a great idea for parties , especially if it was paired with another type of chip that could be used for dipping . this flavor would also be great for parties because it appeals to almost all people ( with taste buds ) . the common misconception is that these chip bags are all air , but that could not be further from the truth . while these bags do contain nitrogen to preserve the chips , they contain the same amount of chips as every other variety . i do find , however , that about qqq to qqq percent of the chips on the bottom get crushed , but this might not happen to everyone , and in reality , this phenomenon is quite normal . with a price so low and the convenience of buying these online , it is hard to pass up such a deal ! i highly recommend this product to everyone !

( the reason i mention storage is because it 's not good to have pancake mix sitting around in an improperly sealed box or bag for long periods of time . i 've had enough bad experiences with mold to feel moved enough to share this here because this is the " family size " package that might end up sitting in your cabinet for a few months at least . i 've heard horror stories of people getting sick from mold toxin because just enough moisture slowly built up and mold grew , and it was n't easily noticeable , probably in part because of the consistency of the powdery medium not being a solid surface like you might notice mold on cheese for example . knowing what i know about mold , it 's probably not all that common , but if the box or bag sits around long enough in a moist climate without being completely sealed it might just be enough to allow slow growth of just the wrong kind of mold . what makes the nasty mold dangerous is the toxins it releases over time . so just do yourself a favor and invest in a storage container ( or use a big folger 's plastic " can " with a storage bag , like i did ) and keep your floury substances away from moisture and storage in a well - sealed container . ) on a happy note , forget doing these pancakes injustice with fake " maple " syrup . if you are willing to spend more than a dollar on a cup of coffee , why put junk on your pancakes ? go the extra mile with this vermont gold <a data - hook="product - link - linked " class="a - link - normal " href="/hidden - springs - natural - vermont - maple - syrup - amber - qqq - ounce / dp / qqq / ref = cm_cr_arp_d_rvw_txt?ie = qqq springs natural vermont maple syrup , amber rich , qqq ounce</a > . a little goes a long way . right now qqq oz is about $ qqq if you do subscribe and save .

( note : comparison to brown sugar : i detected a hint of sweetness , but saw qqq point spike in my blood sugar at qqq - minutes ) . in beverages : the test : again to test this , i used qqq qqq oz glass of ice tea with no additional ingredients ( just loose leaf black tea i brew ) the product : i added qqq tsp of the coconut sugar ( qqq the suggested serving amount ) to my ice tea results : much the same as above . i found a slight color shift to brown , and no appreciable sweetening effect of the tea ( it tasted no sweeter than just plain ice tea , minus the flavor profile shift of the coconut sugar ) . comparison : my comparison was ( same as above ) to check my blood sugar immediately prior to consuming and then qqq minutes after consuming and again qqq hour after consuming . i found my blood sugar spiked slightly ( qqq points ) with the coconut sugar as opposed to plain ice tea or ice tea ( sweetened with qqq packet of equal ( qqq g of weight ) . i did not test with sugar at this time , as i felt my results between the oatmeal test and ice tea test already indicated a sufficient trend . c. nutritional value - the claim is the low glycemic and minerals and nutrients . according to the package 's nutritional information panel , the highest mineral concentration is potassium ( qqq mg ) followed by sodium ( qqq mg ) and rounding off the bottom : total carbohydrate ( qqq g ) and sugars ( qqq g ) . ( note : to compare , qqq average sized banana contains approximately qqq mg of potassium ( qqq % of the dra for an adult ) . conclusion : for me , i find no significant value in using this product in neither management of glycemic tolerance nor sweetening of food and beverage . while an argument can be made for nutritional benefit , this benefit , in my opinion , is negligible . basically , i find this product to be a non - functional " sweetener " with an unappetizing food colorization and slight flavor profile shift that provided no discernible sweetness . as to nutritional value , i find this product worst of all ) near - negligible nutritional value . i do n't find it a better option than just a balanced , nutritious diet . i do n't find it has significant benefit to diabetes management , and i strongly urge any diabetic to discuss the concerns of relying on this product to aid in diabetes care management with a licensed professional nutritionist / endocrinologist . the only benefit i did find , is it was less taxing on my insulin / blood sugar levels than equal amounts of refined sugar . in closing , these results are only self - observed . however , the results did show me that , for me anyway , the keys to proper weight control / diabetes management is sensibility and moderation .

i 'm one of those people on the gummy vitamin bandwagon and i 'm likely not to get off of it any time soon . there are some very positive aspects of this particular gummy but there are also some not - so - positive aspects . first of all , they taste pretty good , even with the inclusion of fish oil ( vitafusion also makes a good qqq ) . not as tasty as other brands ( again , i mention vitafusion ) but pretty good . there is a bit of a weird aftertaste but not enough to offend me . the consistency is more like a gum drop than the typical gummy candy and sticky to the teeth . what i really like is the fact that they are non - gmo and you get a nice dose of qqq and some extra qqq ( i also take qqq supplement , which i will continue to do ) . there are no artificial ingredients , colors or preservatives and they are gluten free . also , made is the usa ( a major plus and probably one of the reasons the cost is so high ) . they donate ( or match ) vitamins to vitamin angels ( for children in need ) and i 'm guessing this is also figured into the cost of a jar of these ( but it 's a good cause so that 's something to consider ) . on the negative side , $ qqq for qqq vitamins is too much ( qqq - day supply ) , particularly with the economy the way it is . also too much is the calorie count ( qqq calories for six gummies with qqq grams of sugar and qqq grams of carbs ) ( i do n't know why the serving size is six gummies but it is ) . personally , i find it hard to eat six of these so i make cut it back to two per day and take my other supplements until i run out . and i likely will not repurchase these due to the high cost . also , it would be nice if there were a higher level of calcium ( especially considering they get the qqq from anchovies and sardines , which i always knew to be calcium rich because of the bones ) . at the end of the day , this particular vitamin , though costly and incomplete in many ways , may be a good solution for people who have a hard time taking capsules or tablets . and having the vitamin seem candy - like may be just the thing for some people who would otherwise be unable or unlikely to take any supplement at all ( that is , if they can afford $ qqq per month for just the one supplement ) . this turns out to be not the right choice for me but i encourage people to try them as they may end up working for others . unfortunately , i searched to see if a smaller bottle was available for purchase for people just wanting to try these but they only seem to come in the qqq count bottles .

this is about the best tasting peanut butter around , and i like that it is fairly natural without much added except a bit of sugar and salt . however , the fact that there is no need to stir means that it has been homogenized , and that is hardly a natural process . it is a chemical process that involves fusing and changing molecular structure ( in a nutshell ) , and these types of changes are not " natural . " also , the palm oil in this peanut butter may or may not be ok . i am happy that it is not canola oil . however , there is nothing stating that it is expeller or cold pressed , and that does make a huge difference . oils heated to high heat become rancid , resulting in the release of free radicals in the body . the beneficial properties are lost , and these types of oils can cause various types of disease . generally , when the oils are cold and expeller pressed , the product would state such . but this is probably one of the best compromises between taste , texture , and still being somewhat natural . so if you like the convenience of not having to stir the separated peanut butter and oil , and want something pretty natural and great tasting , this is a wonderful choice . i paid full price for this item . all opinions are my own .

the description on the product page seems to indicate that this is a two in one or all in one style shampoo and conditioner combo type product , but the instructions on the actual bottle say otherwise . the bottle states clearly to use the clear shampoo total care shampoo with their total care conditioner . that 's important , because using this shampoo alone left my long , thick and healthy hair feeling dryer than usual , tangled and looking like a giant puffy mushroom when i dried it . i had to use a spray on , leave in conditioner and do the " bad hair day pony tail " . not amused . using this with a regular conditioner was better , but not much . the shampoo itself smells nice - a light and airy coconut scent that is n't overwhelming . it lathers well and my hair is clean , but twice i 've been forced to resort to the pony tail look and adding the extra leave in conditioner after my shower . this shampoo is definitely stripping moisture or something from my normally soft hair . i 'll be returning to my suave moroccan infusion . if you have short , straight hair it might be fine .

whenever people without kids hear about the mischief that toddlers get into , they make comments about how it 's the parent 's fault for not properly supervising their child 's every waking moment . the truth is , if you have only one child , do n't work outside the home , hardly sleep , and never shower , it might be possible to monitor your child in such a fashion as to avoid any possible calamity . it really does n't take more than a couple of minutes for a two year old to notice that mom is busy talking to the person at the front door , and seize the opportunity to grab the markers / crayons that the older kids are using for art class , head up the stairs , and create a mural on the wall . two minutes later , mom calls out for said child , and he comes down the stairs with a guilty expression . " i 'm not doing any - sing . " " where are you not doing anything ? " " i 'll show you . " the guilty expression is then replaced by one of excitement and pride in his accomplishment . first this is a large can of nuts . if you do n't regularly eat nuts they could get a bit stale before you get to the bottom of the can . for me , i like nuts so i eat them all the time as snacks so them getting stale is not a problem for me :-) . pros : good mix of nuts , more almonds than other products ( which i like ) cons : big can ( not a problem for me but for the lite eaters maybe ) i appreciate the ratio of peanuts to other nuts . in a lot of other mixed nuts packages ( costco , store brand , etc . ) the amount of peanuts is usually quite high . in these the peanuts are plentiful but not too many . my son , who really likes peanuts , instead of mixed , complains at times about the lack of peanuts in this can . this mix has peanuts , almonds , cashews , brazil nuts , hazelnuts and pecans . the quantities basically fall into this order as well ( i like the ratio or almonds in this mix ) . could have a few more hazelnuts for me and omitting the pecans would not hurt my feelings at all but that 's just personal preference . this mix is seasoned with sea salt and it 's a pretty good ratio and sea salt is better for you than other salts but for me it could have a bit more salt , but then my wife is always threatening to buy me a salt like to satisfy my craving :-) . overall this is my favorite mixed mixed nut product . happy eating :-) < a data - hook="product - link - linked " class="a - link - normal " href="/planters - mixed - nuts - with - pure - sea - qqq - oz - tin / dp / qqq / ref = cm_cr_arp_d_rvw_txt?ie = qqq mixed nuts with pure sea salt , qqq oz . tin</a >

this is billed as a medium roast with citrusy flavor . that is accurate . it is a dark but smooth cup with a good deal of acidity . it has that characteristic european breakfast coffee taste ; similar to many of the popular blends you find in european grocery stores or in cafes when you stop for a quick cup of filtered coffee . i prepared it using a pour - over filter and i got a dark brew with little bitterness , very smooth but that bright acidity that points to a central american origin for this blend ( guatamalan possibly . ) guatamalan is one of the most popular coffees in germany and this seems to be aimed to that market . if you like smooth coffee without the burnt flavor , with lemony - chocolate overtones , you will like this . i found it a very acceptable cup . it 's not terribly aromatic and it 's not that fresh anymore when sold pre - ground but it 's pretty good for what it is .

i purchased the aussie leave in conditioner when i saw it on the amazon pantry so i thought i 'd give it a try . i had high hopes for this product , because i usually love aussie items ( especially the smell of the sprays & shampoos ) . unfortunately , it fell short of my expectations . it 's " okay " ( qqq stars ) . not bad , & not great- just in between ( thus the qqq rating ) . the leave in conditioner has a nice smell , although it 's not as good as some of the shampoos . i have very dry , mid - length , thick hair that has been colored & this winter my hair has been extra dry & frizzy due to the weather . so in preparing this review , i 'm comparing it to other " leave in conditioner " products & the results i received using other items compared to this aussie hair insurance . other people with thin hair , or hair in good condition , may have different results using this product . while using this it did help somewhat with the frizziness , but not as well as other leave in conditioners i 've used . this comes in a plastic bottle with a spray nozzle top . it sprays easily , & you can easily distribute the conditioner in your hair if you spray it , and then comb it thru . smell : qqq ( did n't love it , did n't hate it- just " ok " to me ) . it did n't smell as good as other aussie products i 've tried . removes tangles : qqq ( it does n't help remove tangles ) . softness- did it make my hair a lot softer ? no- qqq ( helped slightly ) . value for your money : qqq ( economical . at the time of this review , it is the lowest cost i 've seen for a leave in conditioner ) overall , i think this a basic , budget leave in conditioner . if you have thin hair , this may work better for you than it did for me . i 'd recommend it for someone who qqq ) has thin hair , or qqq ) has hair that is in good condition already or qqq ) looking for an economical leave in conditioner . if you have dry , damaged hair , this may not be a fix for that ( there are other brands that work better for dry / damaged hair , however they are much more costly ) . so , i 'd weigh the options based on the current condition of your hair & your budget , to see if this is right for you . :)

you 're either a saltine fan or you 're not . there really are n't any in - betweeners on this one . so for the saltine fans , this is a great leap forward in snacking enjoyment - smaller packages of the great saltines we love , so that we are n't forced into eating more than we want or risk the leftovers going stale . with about qqq crackers in a package , that 's just about enough to satisfy a craving or eat them with soup during a meal . these saltines are crunchy and topped with sea salt ( a step up from the regular salt of old ) . a few stats about the package : - it arrived in good condition , just like the type of box i 'd want to buy at the store . - expiration date : february qqq , qqq - fun fact : there is a reason for the holes in saltines ( or all crackers ) - the holes allow the cracker to bake properly . without the holes , steam would n't be able to escape from the cracker during baking , and the cracker would rise up like a biscuit . the holes allow the cracker to remain flat and crispy . if you 'd like more info about prime pantry bestsellers , click on my name ( ppantryreviews ) to check out my website .

press - n seal is a very interesting product . it 's much different from most plastic wraps in a sense that it actively adheres to almost all surfaces , including some which a standard plastic wrap would not . this design gives it additional usage beyond more conventional products . i have found i can use press - n seal for things i can not with standard plastic wrap . liquids , for example , i will use with press - n seal given the adhesion to whatever container you use is strong enough to keep liquids in . with foods that can quickly go stale such as bread , this stuff makes a stronger seal than your standard clear wrap , and i find bread stays fresher in this . as i like having the ability to microwave something covered in clear wrap , press - n seal has great resistance to high temperatures and works well with microwaves ... and being bpa - free is a big plus for this kind of usage . i also find that it does not modify the flavor of foods in the microwave , which is another plus . while i do not use this with my freezer much , this stuff is strong and i imagine it will work well for freezer usage ... and i also imagine the really good seal will really help reduce freezer burn ! the two downsides i have noticed are the price and how it can leave a residue on some products . the price is justifiable based on the convenience of the product , and i use bar keeper 's friend to clean dishes and cookware , which removes the residue immediately ( and removes everything else , like baked on food , grease , stains , etc . ) i do still keep a massive roll of kirkland clear wrap to use in combination with this . for some uses , less expensive clear wrap would make more sense , and so i use the kirkland on things in which the stronger seal is not of huge concern .

in the past , i have tried listerine whitening strips and rembrandt qqq - hour . my husband ( age qqq and a coffee drinker ) , has tried products from our dentist with the tray and bleaching product called nite white . nite white only whitened his teeth about one shade . we were not happy with that result and ordered twice , thinking the first one was bad or near expiration . second one did n't do anything either . on nite white , he went from the light brown stage to a very dark yellow stage - not much improvement at all ... in fact barely noticeable . he seemed to want to give up on the process , but i convinced him to just try the strips and now he 's preferring them to the tray treatments . so i happened to find a $ qqq coupon in the mailers and said what the heck , and picked these up at target . they were $ qqq there , so kind of pricey , but we did n't want to try nite white any more and have another poor result . with the crest qqq professional effects , and after qqq strips , he is now seeing very marked improvement . he is happy to finally be seeing a true result and wants to continue with his progress . i tried them once and had improvement already . one box will certainly be enough for both of us . they adhere well to the teeth , and when removing just start on one side at the back and pull around to the other side . we use sensodyne to help reduce the sensitivity that may occur . i did have some sensitivity even after one strip - but my husband has n't had any , but he uses sensodyne daily . common sense prevails and always consult your dentist to make sure you can use this product safely . we always get regular cleanings and checkups . we both love the results we are seeing .

after enjoying this same brands vanilla nut coffee i decided to try the hazelnut variety and like it , as well . taste is subjective , but the company seems to have a knack for flavoring coffees without the usual unpleasant aftertaste that is common with others i have purchased . unexpectedly , the hazelnut coffee also has a noticeable coconut flavor which i , and the other adult in residence , thought an excellent addition . the coffee smells great in the can and while brewing . there is no acidic bite or bitterness in the cup very smooth and rich . as is the case with the majority of flavored coffees , this is a medium roast , and although with my usual coffees i purchase dark , this blend is not at all weak and the flavors of hazelnut , coconut and the coffee itself are well balanced . impressive for a moderately priced brand . any leftovers are good for use in iced coffee or frozen in ice cube trays for use in cooling iced coffee without diluting the beverage and the cubes also works well in smoothies . ground coffee quickly loses freshness once the can is opened , so if i do not plan to consume the full quantity within a week , i will vacuum seal portions for future use . this brand is one i only occasionally find locally , so it is a time - saver to order it here , and the hazelnut flavor is one i will buy again . the can i received has a best before date qqq months in future .

i received a generous sample of this as an " extra " in a subscription box and i 've been using it for the past week or so instead of my usual dawn . i 'm pretty happy with it . i actually think the smell is stronger than the dawn smell , but i find it pleasant ( this review is for the lemon verbena variety , in case product listings ever get merged ) . i am quite happy that this does not contain any artificial dyes ; the color is n't very exciting , as a result , but you 're also getting less junk , which is nice , especially since you 're using this on items that will later touch your food . this makes suds very well and has been great at cleaning all the dishes i 've tried it on so far . i had a microwave container with cheese crusted onto it . i soaked it in soapy water ( with this being the soap ) for a half hour or so and i was then able to get the cheese right out . i think this was even easier with mrs. meyer 's than with dawn . it 's also been great for cleaning out pots and pans i cooked with ; my frying pan is starting to lose its nonstick coating and has been harder to clean , but this helped a lot . all - in - all , i 'm pleased to find a mostly natural product that 's as effective as a more popular , name brand product .

i bought this carpet cleaner in order to try to get up some of the random stains throughout our carpet , including pet stains and kid spills . it works fairly well , though the type of stain and age of stain really have an impact on how well this seems to work . the newer , dirt stains came up very easily with just a spray , short soak , and wipe . some of the other stains were a little tougher , but either came out eventually or got a lot lighter . my only complaint is that it did n't work very well on the cat barf cleanup . this was fresh orange cat barf ( you 're welcome , do n't ask me why my car barfs orange ) , and there is still a slight orange - tinted stain . i have been using nature 's miracle on pet incidents , like this , which seems to work a bit better . all in all , though , this is a good stain remover for a good price . if you have regular stains , give it a try . if you have more difficult pet stains , i 'd stick with a pet stain specific cleaner , though .

as someone who is sensative to perfumes , i have bought my share of detergants and other products that claim to be " fragernce free " or various other claims in the same vain . i have come to assume anything claiming to be fragreance free to mean that the scent is not as strong or non - offensive . these tide pods are actually the first to claim such a thing and deliver on a scentless scent . this is usually good enough for my nose because it is strong scents that give me migranes . after using them i took a big wiff of my cloths which just smelled ... well , wet . so those that are extremely sensative , you will definately want to give these a try . as for the pods working as it deals with actually cleaning the clothes , they do an average job , they will not get out any big stains but still do a solid job on daily use clothing . the pros and cons are obvious , it is nice to not have to measure out the right amount ( which can get messy if you are using powder ) but if you are only washing a half load , you are wasting more detergant than you need .

wheat thins and triscuits are my all time favorite crackers ! what i love about wheat thins though is they can either be eaten standalone , which is how i normally eat them , or with toppers such as cheese , which i have on occasion . triscuits however , are on the dry side , and while you can eat them on their own , i most always eat them with cheese . i find wheat thins to have a nice , sort of nutty , flavor , and has just the right amount of salt , which like a lot of crackers , is just on one side . i love all things salty , so when i eat them , i m always trying to make sure i get the salt side down so it hits my tongue . doing it this way hits my taste buds in all the right places as i eat each cracker . and the cracker is just the right size to pop the whole thing in your mouth , so if the salt side is up , i can easily flip it down with my tongue before i begin chewing it . maybe its part ocd , but hey , what can i say , its how i like to eat them ! :)

i 've been using this for years and have always been pleased with the performance . there are a number of brands that have the same active ingredient and concentration ( qqq % salicylic acid ) , but neutrogena has a nicer smell and is thicker , so the bottle lasts longer . as with any salicylic acid wash , go easy at first -- no more than once every other day until you can determine how your skin reacts . some people are more sensitive to it than others , and it can cause redness and chapping . if all 's good with using it every other day for a couple of weeks , then step it up to once per day . for me , that 's the best frequency , but some people can use it as often as twice a day without any redness . if this proves to be too strong , there are also brands with a qqq % concentration of salicylic acid that are easier on the skin . it 's a very effective blemish treatment option that 's easy to use and much less expensive than the " upscale " brands ( which often have the exact same active ingredient ) .

i do n't normally write an unfavorable review because i usually check things out before i make a purchase but after many years of using this product i find it to be inferior to what drew me to it in the first place . these were once good tissues but are now just expensive snot rags . these are not the old kleenex and when they say things like rely on durable , qqq - ply thickness paper tissue sheets & absorbent , disposable facial tissues lock in moisture its time for a reality check . the old qqq - plys were much thicker & more absorbent and you could blow your nose , stick it in a pocket and it d be good to go for another use . one good blow into these and its a wet ball that stays wet while soaking pretty much the whole tissue . i m an average guy about qqq and qqq - pounds and when my nose runs these are often good only for a single use but with a few blows they most often have to be tossed . stick one in my pocket and it ll be a solid wad when i pull it out . i ve even had to wash my hands because i m all wet with a single use . my wife is petite and has the same issues with these . i do n't have any serious allergies or sinus problems but some mornings it ll take qqq - tissues to start breathing normally . if you 're over qqq you know what i mean about the quality and thickness . is it healthy to carry around a used tissue ... probably not , but i do n't care based on what these now cost . i find a paper towel just purchased a case of sparkle to be much more effective and practical for me they 're harsher but i get a lot of mileage for less expense . i think these are now about the equivalent of using the qqq - sheet scott bathroom tissue on your nose so , perhaps , tissue now defines both products equally and you do n't need to call them facial or bathroom . since many used tissues likely go down the toilet we burn ours they have probably been thinned down to be more sewer system friendly . after complaining about them i will say they are much better than the off brands in the stores that have more per box and more economical than many of the brand names that offer fewer tissues per box . however , the deal of the day at the grocery store will be the way to go because paying a premium for these is just a waste on money . i went with qqq - stars because the downsizing and thinning of products is growing tiresome like a qqq - ounce potato chip bag that is labeled family size so end of rant .

i recently started drinking pau d'arco tea for medicinal purposes , as it is highly recommended and touted to be very beneficial for yeast overgrowth ( candida albicans ) , among other things . i 'd like to preface by saying that nothing ( food , tea , supplement , etc . ) , no matter how therapeutically effective it might be , will do you any good if you do n't eat , drink or take it . so , when it comes to something like tea , the flavor is very important . i find that i like the flavor of traditional medicinals pau d'arco tea well enough when its hot or relatively warm . but i find that the flavor changes rather substantially as the tea cools . the change in the taste is not very palatable ( to me ) when its at room temperature , lukewarm , or cold . in my case , this is a pretty significant drawback since i live in the southwest and during the hot summer months , i avoid drinking hot beverages and prefer to drink my tea cold . so , i look for teas that taste good hot or cold . as traditional medicinals is the first and only pau d'arco tea that i 've tried , i have nothing to compare it to . because i understand the amazing health benefits associated with pau d'arco , i will try other brands . i 'm open to the idea that this change in flavor is a feature of this tea . and , it may be that traditional medicinals will actually be the best tasting . i 'll come back and update this review at a future date .

imagine a time when you have crawled into a freshly made bed and pulled the sheets up to your ears . maybe it was at a luxury resort or maybe it was when you were five and had the flu . either way , there is a restful feeling of sliding into bed and inhaling a lungful of clean , fresh linen . that is what everything smells like when it is washed in shimmer . the smell is fresh and light , but it stays for weeks . i will pull a t - shirt out of the bottom of my drawer after a few weeks and the t - shirt will still smell like shimmer . there was a guy whom i adored . he went on deployment for a year , but tried to save us both the heartache of a long distance romance by breaking up with me beforehand . he had been hurt in the past and i understood how long a year can be . while he was gone , the bag containing his socks and underwear disappeared . i offered to get him new items and send them to him . first , i washed them all with downy unstopables . ten months later he returned home and i went to see him . as i ran and jumped into his arms , the first words he said to me was , " you smell like pink shimmer . " today , i call that man my husband . was it the downy ? probably not , but it 's still something that we smile about today . mike has a co - worker who will walk up and sniff him . she kept asking him what i washed his clothes in to the point where he had to come home and take a picture and send it to her . this is the best of the best and the most sought after one as well . i 'm pretty sure i own stock in p&g by now . there is nothing that beats crawling into bed linens that have just been washed in shimmer . except maybe belly flopping into a kiddie pool of chocolate pudding ....
